pronunciation: AFFLICT', [Latin affligo, afflicto, of ad and figo, to strike; eng. flog; Gr. to strike; , Latin plaga, a stroke. Hence, eng. flail, g being suppressed; Latin flagellum. See Flog.]

definitions.text:
1. To give the body or mind pain which is continued or some permanence; grieve, or distress; as, one is afflicted with the gout, or with melancholy, or with losses misfortunes.
They thy heritage, O Lord. Psalms 94:5.
2. To trouble; harass; distress.
